intro: Utricularia longeciliata, commonly known as the long-stemmed bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, translucent bladders that function as traps to capture prey. This species typically grows in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, such as ponds and marshes. Its leaves are usually thin and filamentous, with the bladders attached to the stems. Utricularia longeciliata is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia.
